meanings.definition: To squirt a liquid, especially saliva, out of the mouth.
meanings.sent1: The boy gleeked water from his mouth while playing with his friends.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally gleeked on her friend while laughing at a funny joke.
meanings.sent3: The comedian gleeked water at the audience, creating a hilarious moment.
meanings.sent4: The fountain gleeked water into the air, resembling a playful dolphin.
meanings.sent5: The water gun gleeked a stream of water, surprising everyone around.

meanings.definition: To make a joke or jest.
meanings.sent1: During the party, he gleeked a funny joke that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: She gleeked a witty remark that lightened the mood in the room.
meanings.sent3: The clown gleeked a silly joke, causing the children to giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His words gleeked through the serious conversation like a burst of laughter.
meanings.sent5: The stand-up comedian gleeked hilarious anecdotes, entertaining the audience.

meanings.sent1: The friends gleeked together at the funny movie they watched.
meanings.sent2: She gleeked with joy when she received good news.
meanings.sent3: The baby gleeked happily at the colorful toys in the playroom.
meanings.sent4: His laughter gleeked through the quiet library, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's jokes gleeked the audience into fits of laughter.
